column5: I saw the SnoBear on Real Fishing last week. One of the coolest ice fishing vehicles I've ever seen.  Does anyone know how much they cost?  http://www.snow-bear.com/
Think that I read somewhere that they were $22,000 U.S.  Don
DEFINATELY A SWEET RIDE!!! I SAW THAT SHOW AS WELL!!! SURE WOULD BE NICE!!!
Mid 30's + tax Cdn. "Nippissing" and his brothers at Geisler Marine in Powassan have/had one for sale.  I believe the higher price in Canada includes Bob Izumies(sp) commission....
If it had a convertible top and was buoyant it would be the ultimate amphibious vehicle what else would you need other than a trolling motor
Easton they did mention on the show that if it falls through the ice it will float.
It does float. Ultimate fish shack for sure.
I may have to order one....or not! It is missing a hot tub so that was the deal breaker.

Ok links below will give you a lot more info on them...like 4000 hours of engineering that went into it.  Price From $33000 to $50000 US dollars....  http://money.cnn.com/2007/01/30/magazines/...g.fsb/index.htm  http://www.oemoffhighway.com/article/artic...on=2&id=113
Saw the Snowbear trailer a few months ago, neat vehicle, but unpractical for where I go.  Betcha Joe and Art could whip up a similar downsized one, with a jet drive for softwater season, in a week,
